CustomBehavior.Text: Your toon must be able to fly in Kalimdor and Eastern Kingdoms to use this profile.
You must have four free 'normal' bag slots to start this profile.\nPlease make some room in your inventory and restart the profile.

Do NOT AFK this profile!

* You should turn off any plugins or Combat Routine features that use Slowfall abilities. Otherwise, the "Almost Blind Luck" achievement will be acquired after you run out of Slowfall reagents (we keep trying until we get the achievement).

* It goes into areas with many, many people around. You should keep an eye on profile progression.

* Honorbuddy navigation _loves_ to get stuck.
The Brewfest scenery decorations provide a wealth of opportunities for this.

* Moving around while drunk causes you to fall a lot (and sometimes die), since Honorbuddy loves to path on the bloody edge of a dropoff. Honorbuddy navigation leaves no room for the error induced by drunkeness.

* Honorbuddy occasionally has problems with Intercontinental travel, which is needed for one of the quests.

* Honorbuddy occasionally gets confused about 'quest state'.
It will think something is incomplete when its done. We've made the profile very stop/start friendly to work around this.

* To turn this warning message off, edit the profile. Look for a comment with the words "WARN USER" and change the 'true' to 'false'.

CustomBehavior.DestName: Brewfest Food Court center near entrance

CustomBehavior.Text:
You must TURN OFF any plugins that use SLOWFALL abilities...

Otherwise, the achievement will be deferred until you run out of appropriate slowfall reagents.

(This message will self-dismiss in a few seconds.)

We were FAILED TO GET the "Almost Blind Luck" ACHIEVEMENT.

This can happen for numerous reasons. Your options are:
* Stop the profile, and do the achievement manually, or
* Let the profile automatically try again in a few seconds

CustomBehavior.DestName: Brewfest Food Court center near entrance

TurnIn.QuestName: This One Time, When I Was Drunk...

CustomBehavior.Text: Working the "Have Keg, Will Travel" achievement.

You do not have the "Have Keg, Will Travel" achievement.\n\nYou also don't have enough Brewfest Prize Tokens to claim the achievement. For now we'll have to skip it, and we'll try again when you restart the profile. Hopefully, by then you will have additional Brewfest Prize Tokens from doing Brewfest dailies.
Whoops, you're not where we left you.\n\nPlease move to Kalimdor and start the profile again.
Whoops, you're not where we left you.\n\nPlease move to Eastern Kindgoms and start the profile again.
Whoops, you're not where we left you.\n\nPlease move to Silvermoon City and start the profile again.
Turning in "Pink Elekks on Parade" quest.
Whoops, you're not where we left you.\n\nPlease move to Kalimdor and start the profile again.

CustomBehavior.Text:
END of the line. Here is what's left:

* Quest: "This One Time, When I Was Drunk..."
Every 30mins the Dark Iron Dwarves will invade Brewfest.
If the players are successful in repelling them, there will be a part remaining on the ground that starts a quest. Take it and simply turn it in. If you already had this quest in your log, we've turned it on for you.

* DAILY Quest: "Direbrew's Dire Brew" quest
You must do Coren Direbrew dungeon by some other means.* When you get 200 Brewfest Prize Tokens, purchase a "Brew of the Month" membership.
